episodeTitle: Ambitions of Fairy Vearth - The Ark, Maxim!!
episodeTitleJapanese: 限りない大地（フェアリーヴァース）への野望方舟マクシム！！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kagirinai Daichi (Fearī Vāsu) e no Yabō Hakobune Makushimu!!
description: Enel demonstrates his overwhelming power by defeating both Wyper and Zoro. Nami strategically agrees to accompany Enel to his massive golden ark, the Ark Maxim. Meanwhile, Luffy and Aisa escape from the giant python and discover the devastating aftermath of Enel's attacks.

events.title: Shandia Chief's Message to Young Wyper
events.description: In a flashback, the Shandia Chief speaks to young Wyper and other warriors about the Poneglyph inscribed in their homeland. He explains the 400-year struggle of the Shandia people to protect the Poneglyph and reclaim their sacred land from those who drove them away.
events.significance: Provides crucial context for Wyper's determination and the Shandia's centuries-long battle. Reveals the deep connection between the Shandia and the Poneglyph, foreshadowing the importance of ancient history in the One Piece world.

quotes.text: We have fought for 400 years to protect the words inscribed on the Poneglyph and reclaim our homeland.
quotes.speaker: Shandia Chief
quotes.context: Teaching young Wyper about their sacred duty

events.title: Wyper Stops Enel's Heart with Reject Dial
events.description: Wyper uses his Seastone-equipped Shooter to neutralize Enel's Devil Fruit powers, then strikes him with a Reject Dial at point-blank range. The devastating attack stops Enel's heart, appearing to defeat the self-proclaimed god.
events.significance: Demonstrates the tactical brilliance of combining Seastone with the Reject Dial. Shows that Enel is not invincible and can be harmed by creative strategies. This moment gives false hope before Enel's shocking revival.

quotes.speaker: Wyper
quotes.context: Before using the Reject Dial on Enel

events.title: Enel Revives Himself Using Lightning
events.description: Despite his heart being stopped by Wyper's Reject Dial, Enel regains consciousness by using his Goro Goro no Mi powers to electrically restart his own heart, essentially performing self-defibrillation. This demonstrates his mastery over his Devil Fruit and his understanding of electrical physiology.
events.significance: Reveals the terrifying extent of Enel's Devil Fruit mastery and medical knowledge. Establishes him as nearly unkillable through conventional means. This is one of the most creative uses of a Devil Fruit power in the series, showing how understanding science can amplify abilities.

quotes.text: Did you really think that would be enough to stop a god?
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: After reviving himself from cardiac arrest

events.title: Enel Debuts 30,000,000 Volt Hino
events.description: Enel strikes one of the drums on his back with his staff, creating a massive bird-shaped lightning discharge with 30 million volts. The lightning bird, called 'Hino,' attacks Wyper with devastating force, completely overwhelming the Shandia warrior.
events.significance: First appearance of Enel's drum-based lightning techniques, showcasing his ability to shape electricity into animal forms. Named after the thunder god in Iroquois mythology, this attack demonstrates Enel's creative combat abilities.

events.title: Wyper's Defeat
events.description: The 30,000,000 Volt Hino strikes Wyper with overwhelming electrical force, defeating the Shandia warrior despite his incredible resilience. Wyper falls unconscious, unable to continue fighting against Enel.
events.significance: Marks the defeat of one of the strongest Shandia warriors and eliminates a major threat to Enel's plans. Shows that even the most determined fighters cannot overcome Enel's electrical power through conventional means.

events.title: Zoro Attempts to Use the Seastone
events.description: After Wyper's defeat, Zoro seizes the opportunity to grab the Seastone weapon, attempting to use it against Enel. However, before he can effectively utilize it, Enel quickly counters.
events.significance: Shows Zoro's tactical thinking in recognizing the value of the Seastone weapon. Unfortunately, his weakened state and Enel's speed prevent him from successfully employing this strategy.

events.title: Enel Debuts Kiten Technique
events.description: Enel taps one of his shoulder drums with his staff, creating a large wolf-shaped mass of lightning called 'Kiten.' The electrical wolf lunges at its target with a powerful bite, severely electrocuting the opponent. Named after a thunder beast from Japanese folklore.
events.significance: Second drum-based technique revealed, showing Enel's versatility in shaping lightning. Demonstrates his ability to create different animal-shaped attacks from different drums on his person.

events.title: Zoro's Defeat by Enel
events.description: Enel's Kiten attack strikes Zoro with devastating electrical power, defeating the swordsman. With Zoro unconscious, Enel has now eliminated all major threats in Upper Yard except for Nami and the escaping Luffy.
events.significance: Demonstrates Enel's overwhelming superiority as he systematically defeats the Straw Hat Pirates' second-strongest fighter. Leaves Nami as the only conscious person facing Enel.

events.title: Nami Agrees to Go with Enel
events.description: With everyone else defeated or unconscious, Nami tells Enel that she would like to accompany him to the 'Land of Dreams' (Fairy Vearth). This is a strategic decision, as she hopes to find an opportunity to escape or sabotage his plans from within.
events.significance: Shows Nami's survival instincts and tactical thinking under pressure. This decision puts her in a unique position to learn about Enel's plans and potentially interfere with them. Demonstrates her character growth in making difficult strategic choices.

quotes.text: I want to go with you to the Land of Dreams.
quotes.speaker: Nami

events.title: First Appearance of the Ark Maxim
events.description: Nami follows Enel to a hidden cave where his massive flying ark, the Ark Maxim, is revealed. The enormous golden ship is shown in all its glory, constructed from gold taken from the ancient City of Gold. It features a massive golden face at the front and is equipped with multiple propellers and generators.
events.significance: Introduces one of the most important vehicles in the Skypiea Arc. The Ark Maxim is central to Enel's plan to destroy Skypiea and reach the moon (Fairy Vearth). Its construction from Shandora's gold represents the desecration of the Shandia's sacred heritage.

quotes.text: Behold, the Ark Maxim! My vessel to the endless land!
quotes.speaker: Enel

events.title: Enel Reveals the Ark Maxim's Power System
events.description: Enel explains that the Ark Maxim was built by Gan Fall's men using gold from the ancient City of Gold as a conductor for his electrical powers. He reveals that his Devil Fruit abilities serve as the primary power source, with 200 Jet Dials from Birka as backup power, enabling the ark to fly even to space.
events.significance: Explains the technological marvel behind the Ark Maxim and shows Enel's planning and preparation. Reveals that he brought resources from his destroyed homeland of Birka. Demonstrates the combination of ancient gold, Sky Island technology, and Devil Fruit powers.

events.title: Enel's Dream of Fairy Vearth Revealed
events.description: Enel reveals his ultimate goal: to travel to 'Fairy Vearth' (literally meaning 'Endless Earth'), which he believes to be the moon. He describes it as a legendary land of infinite expanse covered in sacred earth, the true realm worthy of a god like himself.
events.significance: Reveals Enel's true motivation and endgame. This foreshadows his eventual journey to the moon in the cover story 'Enel's Great Space Operations.' Shows that his destruction of Skypiea is merely a means to an end.

quotes.text: Fairy Vearth... the endless land of sacred earth. That is where a god truly belongs.
quotes.speaker: Enel

events.title: Luffy and Aisa Escape from Nola
events.description: Luffy and Aisa finally escape from inside Nola, the giant python that had swallowed them. They emerge from the unconscious snake, freed from their temporary prison.
events.significance: Allows Luffy to rejoin the main conflict and discover what has happened to his crew. Aisa's Mantra abilities become crucial for locating Enel.

events.title: Luffy Discovers His Defeated Crew
events.description: Upon escaping Nola, Luffy discovers the devastating aftermath of Enel's rampage. He finds his crewmates defeated and unconscious, along with the fallen Shandia warriors. Robin informs him about Enel's plan to destroy all of Skypiea.
events.significance: Establishes the stakes for Luffy's upcoming confrontation with Enel. Seeing his crew defeated intensifies Luffy's determination to stop Enel. This moment parallels other times Luffy has discovered his friends in danger.

events.title: Aisa Uses Mantra to Sense 'Two Voices'
events.description: Aisa uses her innate Mantra (Observation Haki) ability to sense the presence of people across the island. She detects only 'two voices' remaining on Skypiea and offers to guide Luffy to their location, which turns out to be where Enel and Nami are.
events.significance: Demonstrates Aisa's remarkable sensory abilities despite her young age. Her Mantra becomes the key to finding Enel's location. This establishes that most fighters have been eliminated from the conflict, leaving only a handful of survivors.

quotes.text: I can sense only two voices left on this island. I can take you to them!
quotes.speaker: Aisa
quotes.context: Offering to guide Luffy using her Mantra

quotes.text: We have fought for 400 years to protect the words inscribed on the Poneglyph and reclaim our homeland.
quotes.speaker: Shandia Chief
quotes.context: Flashback teaching young Wyper about their duty

quotes.text: Did you really think that would be enough to stop a god?
quotes.speaker: Enel
quotes.context: After reviving himself from cardiac arrest

quotes.text: I want to go with you to the Land of Dreams.
quotes.speaker: Nami

quotes.text: Fairy Vearth... the endless land of sacred earth. That is where a god truly belongs.
quotes.speaker: Enel

quotes.text: I can sense only two voices left on this island. I can take you to them!
quotes.speaker: Aisa
quotes.context: Offering to guide Luffy using her Mantra

themes.description: Enel's godlike abilities and his self-perception as divine are on full display. His resurrection from death and systematic defeat of all opponents showcase both his immense power and his arrogance.
themes.symbolism: Enel's ability to restart his own heart symbolizes his god complex - he literally cannot be killed by mortals in his view.

themes.description: Nami's decision to accompany Enel demonstrates the theme of tactical retreat and strategic thinking over blind heroism. Sometimes survival requires cooperation with the enemy.
themes.symbolism: Nami choosing to stay close to Enel represents playing a dangerous long game rather than making a futile stand.

themes.description: The flashback showing the Shandia Chief teaching young Wyper about their 400-year mission emphasizes how responsibilities and struggles can span generations.
themes.symbolism: The Poneglyph represents ancient knowledge worth protecting across centuries, connecting past to present.

characterSpotlights.development: Enel's terrifying power is fully displayed as he defeats every opponent through both raw power and tactical superiority. His self-resurrection demonstrates his mastery over his Devil Fruit, while the revelation of the Ark Maxim shows his long-term planning.
keyActions: Revives himself by restarting his heart with electricity
Explains his plan to reach Fairy Vearth
quotes: Did you really think that would be enough to stop a god?
Fairy Vearth... the endless land of sacred earth. That is where a god truly belongs.

characterSpotlights.development: Nami shows her intelligence and survival instincts by agreeing to accompany Enel rather than fighting a battle she cannot win. Her tactical approach contrasts with the defeated warriors who chose direct confrontation.
keyActions: Witnesses the defeat of Wyper and Zoro
Agrees to go with Enel to Fairy Vearth
quotes: I want to go with you to the Land of Dreams.

characterSpotlights.development: Through flashback, we see young Wyper being taught about the Shandia's sacred duty. His use of Seastone and Reject Dial shows his tactical preparation, but even stopping Enel's heart proves insufficient.
keyActions: Uses Seastone and Reject Dial to stop Enel's heart

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy escapes from Nola only to discover the devastating results of Enel's rampage. His reaction to seeing his crew defeated sets up his determination for the final confrontation.
keyActions: Learns about Enel's plan from Robin
Teams up with Aisa to track down Enel

characterSpotlights.development: Aisa's Mantra ability proves crucial in locating the remaining survivors and tracking Enel's position. Her natural talent for Observation Haki makes her invaluable despite her young age.
keyActions: Uses Mantra to sense only two voices remaining
Offers to guide Luffy to Enel's location
quotes: I can sense only two voices left on this island. I can take you to them!

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some reaction shots and the reveal of the Ark Maxim compared to the manga panels.

trivia.fact: This is the last episode to use 'A to Z' by ZZ as the ending theme. The ending had been used since episode 168.
The episode had a TV rating of 11.8%, ranking 7th in its broadcast timeslot.
The episode featured Usopp and Sanji as the eyecatcher characters, despite neither appearing in the episode itself.
Enel's technique 'Hino' is named after a thunder god from Iroquois Native American mythology.
Enel's technique 'Kiten' is named after a thunder beast from Japanese folklore.
This episode adapts portions of three manga chapters (275, 276, and 277), demonstrating relatively fast pacing for the anime.
Enel's self-defibrillation is one of the most scientifically accurate uses of a Devil Fruit power, as electrical cardioversion is a real medical procedure.
